It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 27
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Thursday October 27, 1825 session of court, during which two cases involving the possession of slaves were heard. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: Thursday 27
div1.p: Present their Honors J Martin &C Jurors G. Saunders

To all to whom, those presents shall come, Know ye that I Katy Harlen, a citizen of the Cherokee Nation, on account of the Natural love & affection which I have and feel towards my affectionate daughter Sarah West as well as for divers other good causes & considerations, use wherein, to moving, do by these presents give
and of my own free will accord surrender up to her the said Sarah West all my right title and claim, which I have to a negroe woman named Quate & her two children Lose & Suse, the right of which said Negroes decended to me, as the lawful heir of my beloved brother Five Killer Decd. in testimony whereof I hereunto set my hand & seal this 27th day of October 1825. Katy Harlen x her mark seal Ordered by the Honorable the Supreme Court that Bushey Head shall have another hearing wherein Samuel Carr is plaintiff and Bushey Head Defendant, in the Supreme Court in 1826.
It is the opinion of the Jury that Salley Rain Crow shall hold that negroe Jesse Bushey Head contends for, G. Saunders, Foreman
Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock
